result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Valley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: On or Near a School, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $25 drug testing fee;  this amount is to be added to the existing payment plan; non-payment on this pay plan shall result in, as to this case, a 20 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive.

--serve 120 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber release privileges for all purposes; to commence on May 12, 2014 at 7:00pm.  

--Mr. Valley is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges.  The Court indicates that if Mr. Valley tests positive for marijuana when he reports to commence the jail term, then the jail staff is to continue to test Mr. Valley until he the test results are negative, at which point he is to receive Huber release.  

--to comply with DNA sample provision

--to perform 100 hours of Community Service pursuant to Statute 961.015; the Court requires Mr. Valley to send documentation of the community service hours he has performed; the first report will be due 6/1/14 and then on the 1st day of each month thereafter until 100 hours of Community Service is completed.

case called at 10:05am. 
Defendant Andrew J Valley in court with Attorney Jennifer L Weber.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of Information admitted; reading is waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Constitutional rights given; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated included as to Repeater status; the Court accepts plea, finds Mr. Valley guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Valley to:
--serve 120 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber release privileges for all purposes; to commence on May 12, 2014 at 7:00pm.  
--Mr. Valley is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served, with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges.  The Court indicates that if Mr. Valley tests positive for marijuana when he reports to commence the jail term, then the jail staff is to continue to test Mr. Valley until he the test results are negative, at which point he is to receive Huber release.  
--0 days credit for time already served given

--to perform 100 hours of Community Service pursuant to Statute 961.015; the Court requires Mr. Valley to send documentation of the community service hours he has performed; the first report will be due 6/1/14 and then on the 1st day of each month thereafter until 100 hours of Community Service is completed.

--to comply with DNA sample provision

--pay costs of $268, plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $25 drug testing fee;  this amount is to be added to the existing payment plan; non-payment on this pay plan shall result in, as to this case, a 20 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive. 
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given. 
recess 10:27am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Criminal case settlement

Case called at 9:04 am
Defendant Andrew J Valley in court with Attorney Jennifer L. Weber. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Valley waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.

Attorney Weber informs the Court that the parties have an agreement and requests that the case be set for arraignment and plea and sentencing
Attorney Weber files the Criminal Case Settlement

recess: 9:07 am
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Arraignment & Plea and Sentencing Hearing: to be set within 30 days
Attorney Jennifer Weber

State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - the individual has requested that SPD appear for bail purposes only. A financial evaluation puursuan to WI. Stat 977 and SPD Regulation 2.08 was not conducted. (applicable only if the individual is incarcertated)
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Conflict review worksheet

Case called at 1:28 pm
Defendant Andrew J Valley in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendan that the DOB listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Defendant provides current address to the Court.
Court reviews conflict review worksheet. Court notes that one of the files listed on the conflict review worksheet is listed in the criminal complaint. Court has no knowledge of any of the facts of that case. Court in it's former compacity was the supervisor of the prosecutor assigned to that case. Court finds no conflict and signs the conflict review worksheet.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant wishes to hire counsel so an evaluation was not completed.
Public Service Special Prosecutor notifies Court of scribners error in the body of the language in the first paragraph, it should read 2/23/14.
Court corrects scribners error.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia 
-No presence at 124 S. Main St. Jefferson
-Defendant must appear at the 3/12/14 Pretrial Conference 

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given

Recess: 1:44 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 3/12/14 at 10:00 am
Preliminary Hearing: to be set
